data.chText: 不能永生的；终将死亡的
data.enText: that cannot live for ever and must die

data.chText: 导致死亡的；致命的；非常危急的
data.enText: causing death or likely to cause death; very serious

data.chText: 这一丑闻毁了她的名声。
data.enText: Her reputation suffered a mortal blow as a result of the scandal.

data.chText: 至死方休的；不共戴天的
他们陷入了一场你死我活的争斗中。
data.enText: They were locked in mortal combat (= a fight that will only end with the death of one of them) .

data.chText: 因为害怕他发现我们的秘密，我们终日惶恐不安。
data.enText: We lived in mortal dread of him discovering our secret.
a human, especially an ordinary person with little power or influence

data.chText: 关于天神和凡人的古老传说
data.enText: old stories about gods and mortals

data.chText: 这种事不会落在我们这样的凡夫俗子身上。
data.enText: Such things are not for mere mortals like ourselves.

data.chText: 她可以心算复杂的数字，而我们常人就需要计算器！
data.enText: She can deal with complicated numbers in her head, but we lesser mortals need calculators!

simple_means.memory_skill: mort 死 + al …的 → 死的，致命的

ex.chText: 艾滋病是一种致命的疾病。

ex.enText: The nuclear bomb is one type of deadly weapons.

synonyms.bx: 指事物（如疾病、武器等）致命的。

ex.chText: 他设计的程序中有个致命的缺陷。
ex.enText: There was a fatal flaw in his program.

ex.chText: 那位年轻的候选人在大选中遭受了灾难性的打击。
ex.enText: That young candidate suffered a fatal blow in the election.

synonyms.bx: 强调死亡的不可避免性，多用于指疾病；还可指造成失败或毁灭性后果的。

ex.chText: 他在最后一次战斗中受到了致命的重伤。
ex.enText: He received a mortal wound in the final battle.
Our hotel is in mortal danger.

synonyms.bx: 主要指伤口等致命的，或情况非常危急的。

example: there was too much for one person to do

tr: causing or capable of causing death

value.def: If you refer to the fact that people are mortal, you mean that they have to die and cannot live for ever.

example.ex: A man is deliberately designed to be mortal. He grows, he ages, and he dies.
example.tran: 人注定终有一死：长大、衰老，然后消亡。

value.tran: 终有一死的;不能永生的

example.ex: She has suddenly come face to face with her own mortality.
example.tran: 她突然间陷入了直面死亡的境地。

value.def: You can describe someone as a mortal when you want to say that they are an ordinary person.

example.ex: Tickets seem unobtainable to the ordinary mortal.
example.tran: 普通人好像根本买不到票。

example.ex: ...impossible needs for any mere mortal to meet.
example.tran: 但凡世人皆不可能达到的要求

value.def: You can use mortal to show that something is very serious or may cause death.

example.ex: The police were defending themselves and others against mortal danger...
example.tran: 警察在保护自己和他人免遭致命危险。

example.ex: Broadcasting was regarded at the time as the mortal enemy of live music-making.
example.tran: 广播当时被视为是现场音乐表演的死对头。

value.def: You can use mortal to emphasize that a feeling is extremely great or severe.

example.ex: When self-esteem is high, we lose our mortal fear of jealousy.
example.tran: 自信心很强时，我们不再对妒忌感到极度惧怕。

example.ex: Candida admits to having been 'mortally embarrassed'.
example.tran: 坎迪达承认当时“尴尬得要命”。

trans: 前世今生；人皆有一死；人皆有死

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + mort 死 + ize 使… → 使结束〔贷款〕→ 分期偿还
im 不 + mortal 死 → 不朽的
im 不 + mortal 死 + ize 使 → 使不朽
morb〔= mort〕死 + id 有…性质的 → 能带来死亡的 → 致病的；恐怖的
mori 死 + bund〔= bound 边界〕→ 在死的边界徘徊 → 垂死的
mort 死 + al …的 → 死的，致命的
mort 死 + ality 表状态 → 死亡（率）
mort 死 + ify 使 → 使人想死 → 使受辱
mortu〔= mort〕死 + ary 场地 → 放死尸的地方 → 停尸室
post 后 + mort 死 + em → 死后的
